title: HarfBuzzSharp: Add buffer UTF overloads
body:
This PR adds some missing overloads for the hb_buffer to add text with UTF-16 and UTF-32 encoding.
I have also added some overloads that make it possible to only shape some portion of an encoded sequence. 

Leave me comments if you have questions or find any mistake.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: I would like to update harfbuzz to the latest master but couldn't find where the source link is defined in the build files.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
@Gillibald initially the harfbuzz binding was more of a test, so it does not really have a nice workflow. I actually just downloaded the source tar as part of the steps:
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/cake/BuildExternals.cake#L715-L739

After downloading, I manually created project files (MSBuild, Xcode, Tizen, Makefile) for each platform to compile. I haven't gotten around to updating and using the CMake targets. The actual version that gets pulled in is read from this file:
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/VERSIONS.txt#L5

Just another thing: if this layout is not practical, or you need to get it to build another way, then go ahead and make the adjustments. Due to poor reasoning, it is the way it is now because that is how it was then 😄 Also, the harfbuzz repo has come a long way since 2017.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
The reason I used the source tar instead of the code/submodule was - at the time - there was a few extra files that were generated that I didn't want to regenerate on CI. I believe this was because i didn't want to have to depend on cygwin and things like that. As a result, I just downloaded the files and used the platform project files.

We could switch to a submodule and then just include the files we care about. In fact, rather than downloading this file, I would actually prefer all dependencies as submodules in the externals folder. Both for consistency, and because we will always need all the dependencies for all platforms - 'cause we work ev'rywhere!

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Thanks for the info. I will evaluate what will be the best way for us to get things updated. The ideal would be a submodule solution.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body:
I have added some ReadOnlySpan<byte; char; uint> overloads and only added overloads with (itemOffset, ItemLength) when it makes sense.
There are some mobile platforms I didn't get ReadOnlySpan<T> to compile.

We have to talk about the naming. I realy don't like utf8text; utf16text; utf32text we already have method names that imply the encoding that naming is just wrong in my opinion. If that is a strong requirement I will change the new overloads to match the old naming. For now I just left the naming for old signatures and "fixed" the naming for new ones.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: I will close this PR and will create a new PR with HarfBuzz as a submodule. In that PR I will also add more features to the binding to cover more of the API surface. Is a WIP PR okay or should I finish and polish everything before submitting?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: A PR that track the progress with be great. It will create a point for discussion and you can use our CI to test everything as you go along.
